page.title: 05ECOLOGY,VEGETATION
page.content: The area is predominantly grassland. In the extreme north-west of the area lies the edge of GLAS-FYNYDD FOREST a major Forestry Comission plantation which has now reached maturity and is being clear-felled. This forest covers about 14 square kilometres and extends north-westwards to USK RESERVOIR. Both valleys contain a certain amount of deciduous scrub in those places from which sheep are usually excluded. The upland tract in the south of the area is predominantly uncultivated grassland like the high ground in other parts of the Brecon Beacons. However this is enclosed farmland,not common grazing, so that there have been important attempts to improve the land by draining and application of fertilisers.It is instructive to compare this with FFOREST FACH to the north which is unimproved.
